label: AL rdfs:label@en
definition: AL IAO:0000115@en

label: organism substance
definition: Material anatomical entity in a gaseous, liquid, semisolid or solid state; produced by anatomical structures or derived from inhaled and ingested substances that have been modified by anatomical structures as they pass through the body.

label: ingested food
definition: A substance that is consumed by the organism for food.

label: digestion
definition: The whole of the physical, chemical, and biochemical processes carried out by multicellular organisms to break down ingested nutrients into components that may be easily absorbed and directed into metabolism.

label: Food digestion
definition: Digestion is the breakdown of large insoluble food molecules into small water-soluble food molecules. The breakdown is both mechanical and chemical (enzymatic digestion). During digestion, food components are released from the food matrix and become bioaccessible. Bioaccessible molecules can be absorbed.

label: data set
definition: A data item that is an aggregate of other data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets.

label: plan specification
definition: A directive information entity with action specifications and objective specifications as parts that, when concretized, is realized in a process in which the bearer tries to achieve the objectives by taking the actions specified.

label: protocol
definition: A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process.

label: eats
definition: 'consumer of food' eats food

label: dietary pattern
definition: The quantity, variety, or combination of different foods and beverage in a diet and the frequency with which they are habitually consumed.

label: timing of food intake
definition: fasting, meal frequency, daily, episodic - contributes to dietary regime (protocol)

label: organism food management process
definition: The process an organism has which achieves a dietary pattern and involves food location, selection, episodic consumption, and digestion.

label: fasting process
definition: A food consumption process in which the timing of food and/or liquid ingestion is limited.

label: intermittent fasting
definition: Intermittent fasting is a broad term that encompasses a variety of programs that manipulate the timing of eating occasions by utilizing short-term fasts in order to improve body composition and overall health.

label: time-restricted feeding
definition: A type of intermittent fasting process which allows ad libitum energy intake within controlled time frames, generally a 3-12 hour range each day.
example of usage: involving fasting periods that are longer than a normal overnight fast of 8–12 hours. A form of time restricted eating, typically 16 h fasting and 8 h eating.

label: fasting protocol
definition: A protocol that specifies the timing of food consumption.
example of usage: The fasting protocol indicated fasting for 16 hrs per 24 hrs for a duration of 3 months.

label: episodic food intake process
definition: The process of ingesting food during a single eating and/or drinking session.  This does not include the digestion process.

label: diet by consumer organism
definition: A diet that is defined by the digestive capabilities of a given organism

label: carnivorous diet
definition: The diet of a carnivore, which focuses almost exclusively on the consumption of animal food sources.

label: omnivorous diet
definition: The diet of an omivore, which includes both plant and animal food sources.

label: herbivorous diet
definition: A diet of a herbivore, which focuses almost exclusively on the consumption of plants, fungi and/or lichen.

label: diet by food organism
definition: A diet defined by the food source organisms it allows or excludes.

label: vegetarian diet
definition: A diet which focuses almost exclusively on the consumption of plants, fungi and/or lichen.

label: pescetarian diet
definition: A diet which includes vegetarian food as well as fish and seafood.

label: non-beef diet
definition: A diet that excludes food containing beef food products.

label: non-pork diet
definition: A diet that excludes food containing swine food products.

label: infant breast milk diet
definition: A diet consisting entirely of breast milk.

label: semi-vegetarian diet
definition: primarily a plant-based diet but includes meat, dairy, eggs, poultry and fish on occasion or in small quantities

label: diet by agriculture treatment
definition: A diet which involves food produced under certain agricultural conditions.

label: organic diet
definition: A diet consisting of organically produced food

label: diet by nutritional composition
definition: A diet defined by nutritional or other food bioactive compound presence or absense.

label: ketogenic diet
definition:
The ketogenic diet is a high-fat, low-carbohydrate, adequate-protein diet that mimics a fasting state, resulting in the substitution of ketone bodies as a source of energy. The ketogenic diet can be used to reduce recurrent epileptic seizures in individuals with intractable epilepsy. Intractable epilepsy is defined as epilepsy that failed to respond to three or more antiepileptic drugs.
A high-fat, adequate-protein, low-carbohydrate diet. It is primarily used in medicine to treat difficult-to-control epilepsy in children

label: DASH diet
definition: Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension (DASH) trial, which demonstrated that consuming a diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and low-fat dairy products and reduced in saturated fat and cholesterol

label: Meditteranean diet
definition: The moderate-fat, restricted-calorie, Mediterranean diet was rich in vegetables and low in red meat, with poultry and fish replacing beef and lamb.

label: high-carbohydrate diet
definition: A diet which provides > 60% of total dietary energy from carbohydrates.  It consists predominantly of high glycemic carbohydrates have detrimental metabolic effects

label: low-carbohydrate, high-protien, high fat diet
Discussion on Improvements: The low-carbohydrate, non–restricted-calorie diet aimed to provide 20 g of carbohydrates per day for the 2-month induction phase and immediately after religious holidays, with a gradual increase to a maximum of 120 g per day to maintain the weight loss.

label: high fat diet
definition: A diet involving the a larger proportion of fat than normal.

label: low fat diet
definition: A restricted-energy diet with less than 30 % of energy from fat.

label: glutten free
definition: A diet which minimises or eliminates the consumption of glutten.

label: proscribed diet
definition: An eating pattern that excludes a given diet.

label: prescribed diet
definition: A diet assigned as a dietary pattern objective to an individual or group.

label: dietary regimen
definition: A set of restrictions on food type ingestion and/or timing of food ingestion.

label: self-prescribed diet
definition: A diet that an individual has chosen as a dietary pattern objective.

label: research prescribed diet
definition: A died prescribed to a group in a research study.

label: study intervention diet
definition: ONS: Intervention diet The diet administered during an intervention study. It usually comprises the adoption of a certain nutritional intervention, intended as the prescription of consuming or not consuming certain food, and follows a precise study design. Intervention studies usually compare at least two subgroups of a population, one control group receiving a null nutritional intervention, and one or more test groups receiving the intervention

label: study null nutritional diet
definition:
A dietairy pattern adhered to by a study control group.
(possibly a placebo).

label: medically prescribed diet
definition: ONS: Prescribed Diet A diet prescribed by a physician or nutritionist to meet specific nutritional needs of a person. ~= dietetic diet?

label: dietetic diet
definition: A diet that is specially prepared or processed for an individual on restrictive diets.  RESERVE THIS TERM JUST FOR HUMANS?

label: coeliac diet
definition: A diet designed to reduce the symptoms of Coeliac disease which is caused by a reaction to gliadin (a gluten protein found in wheat) and similar proteins found in other crops.

label: FODMAP diet
definition: A diet involving the avoidance of Fermentable Oligo-Di-Monosaccharides and Polyols.

label: weight loss diet
definition: A diet designed to reduce the presence of fat in an organism.

label: performance diet
definition: A diet which has an athletic performance objective

label: ethnographic diet
definition: A cultural or religious eating pattern.

label: halal diet
definition: A diet consisting of halal approved food.

label: kosher diet
definition: A diet consisting of kosher approved food.

label: self-reported diet
definition: An ingested food data set which is subjectively recorded or recalled by an individual consuming the food

label: objectively-reported diet
definition: An ingested food data set which is observed by a researcher to have been consumed by a subject organism or population of organisms.

label: ingested food data set
definition: A dataset which contains a list of foods that an organism has ingested over some period of time.

label: NCI usual diet
definition: A long-term average daily intake of nutrients and/or foods calculated according to a National Cancer Institute statistical model.

label: ingested food log
definition: An ingested food data set of food consumption events detailing food ingested and the time of ingestion.
Comments: This may include the mass or quantity of a food item, and other details such as its preparation process.'

label: daily food intake
definition: An ingested food data set for a given day.

label: daily average nutritional intake
definition: A dataset containing the averaged daily intake of each of a variety of nutrients for an individual or organism population.

label: population regular diet
definition: ONS: Usual Diet The regular course of eating and drinking adopted by a population in a certain geographical area, or in a certain cultural setting, or following certain common eating behaviour. It is also intended as the diet a person would follow without further prescription or indications, i.e. vegetarian diet

label: individual regular diet
definition: ONS:Diet The regular course of eating and drinking adopted by a person.

label: individual dietary pattern
definition: An eating pattern pertaining to a single organism (an instance of organism). This can be used descriptively or prescriptively.

label: population dietary pattern
definition: An eating pattern pertaining to a population or sub-population of organism.  This can be used descriptively or prescriptively (e.g. pregnant women should not drink more than 2 glasses of wine a day).
